column1: Principles of Administrative Law (1988) 4th  Ed, at p . 325 that;

column2: "Functions  dischargeable  by  the  administration  may  either
be  ministerial or  discretionary. A  ministerial function  is  one
where  the  relevant law  prescribes the duty to be  performed by
the  concerned authority in  certain  and specific  terms  leaving
the  discretion  or  judgment  of the  authority.
does  not involve  investigation  into  disputed facts  or  making
